      • initialize

        public Box[][] initialize()
        Initialize the chess board to get ready for the game to start
        Returns:
        the initialized chess board

      • printboard

        public void printboard​(Box[][] board)
        Print out the chess board at the start of the game and every time a piece is moved
        Parameters:
        board - - the chess board

      • move

        public int move​(Box[][] board,
                int oldx,
                int oldy,
                int newx,
                int newy,
                boolean p)
        Check for invalid inputs Check for special move castling Check if the movement is legal If the movement is legal, check if current player's king is under check. If it is under check then it is an illegal move If the move is legal, check if the current player put the opponent under check or it is checkmate after the move Also checked here if the speical move enpassant is legal
        Parameters:
        board - - the chess board
        oldx - - the original x coordinate for the piece that is going to be moved
        oldy - - the original y coordinate for the piece that is going to be moved
        newx - - the x coordinate the piece is moving to
        newy - - the y coordinate the piece is moving to
        p - - player's turn
        Returns:
        0 if it is just a normal move, 1 if checkmate, 4 if a king is dead, and 11 if opponent under check

      • opponentUnderCheck

        public int opponentUnderCheck​(Box[][] b,
                              int oldx,
                              int oldy,
                              int newx,
                              int newy,
                              boolean p)
        After finding out your movement is legal, check if the move put the current player's king under check. If the move puts the current player's king under check, return -1 and it will be an illegal move. Then we check if the current player puts his opponent under check, if that is the case return 1. If nothing happens in the move, return 0 and indicate it is a normal move.
        Parameters:
        b - - the chess board
        oldx - - the original x coordinate for the piece that is going to be moved
        oldy - - the original y coordinate for the piece that is going to be moved
        newx - - the x coordinate the piece is moving to
        newy - - the y coordinate the piece is moving to
        p - - player's turn
        Returns:
        -1 if current player's king under check, 0 if nothing happens, 1 if opponent under check

      • checkmate

        public boolean checkmate​(Box[][] b,
                         int oldx,
                         int oldy,
                         int newx,
                         int newy,
                         boolean p)
        For every valid move the current player's king can make, check if the king is still under check after the move. Return false if a move removes the check status for the current player. Return true if checkmate applies.
        Parameters:
        b - - the chess board
        oldx - - the original x coordinate for the piece that is going to be moved
        oldy - - the original y coordinate for the piece that is going to be moved
        newx - - the x coordinate the piece is moving to
        newy - - the y coordinate the piece is moving to
        p - - player's turn
        Returns:
        true if checkmate, otherwise return false

      • opponentKingDead

        public int opponentKingDead​(Box[][] newboard,
                            int kingx,
                            int kingy,
                            int newx,
                            int newy,
                            boolean p)
        This method is used in the checkmate method. Check if opponent's king is under check for this particular move.
        Parameters:
        newboard - - the chess board
        kingx - - king's x coordinate
        kingy - - king's y coordinate
        newx - - the x coordinate the king is moving to
        newy - - the y coordinate the king is moving to
        p - - which player's turn
        Returns:
        0 if nothing happens, -1 if the move is legal but opponent not under check, 1 if the move puts opponent under check

      • tempBoard

        public Box[][] tempBoard​(Box[][] b,
                         int oldx,
                         int oldy,
                         int newx,
                         int newy)
        Creates a temporary chess board in order to test if a new move is legal.
        Parameters:
        b - - the chess board
        oldx - - the original x coordinate for the piece that is going to be moved
        oldy - - the original y coordinate for the piece that is going to be moved
        newx - - the x coordinate the piece is moving to
        newy - - the y coordinate the piece is moving to
        Returns:
        the new chess board for testing
